4.3 Gradient descent in practice I: Feature Scaling

梯度下降运算中的实用技巧——特征缩放

Feature Scaling

Idea: Make sure flatten are on a similar scale.

E.g. x1x_1x1​= size(0-2000 feet2feet^2feet2)

​ x2x_2x2​= number of bedrooms (1-5)

It will be better to limit both x1x_1x1​ and x2x_2x2​ in [0,1]

x1=size(feet2)2000x_1=\frac{size(feet^2)}{2000}x1​=2000size(feet2)​

x2=numberOfBedroom5x_2=\frac{numberOfBedroom}{5}x2​=5numberOfBedroom​

椭圆相较于正圆需要更多的时间来计算梯度下降

More general, get every feature into approximately a −1≤xi≤1-1\le x_i\le1−1≤xi​≤1 range.

范围的上下限并不是被严格限制的，不过越接近-1和1越好。过大和过小都是不合适的。

Mean normalization

Replace xix_ixi​ with xi−µix_i-µ_ixi​−µi​ to make features have approximately zero mean (Do not apply to x0=1x_0=1x0​=1)
E.g.

x1=size(feet2)−10002000x_1=\frac{size(feet^2)-1000}{2000}x1​=2000size(feet2)−1000​

x2=numberOfBedroom−25x_2=\frac{numberOfBedroom-2}{5}x2​=5numberOfBedroom−2​

µiµ_iµi​ (1000 and 2) is considered as the average value of xix_ixi​ in training set

xi←xi−µirange(max−min)x_i\leftarrow \frac{x_i-µ_i}{range(max-min)} xi​←range(max−min)xi​−µi​​

4.4 Gradient descent in practice II: Learning rate

  • The chapter will center around the learning rate α\alphaα

Gradient descent

  • θj:=θj−α∂∂θjJ(θ)\theta_j:=\theta_j-\alpha \frac∂{∂\theta_j}J(\theta)θj​:=θj​−α∂θj​∂​J(θ)
  • “Debugging”: How to make sure gradient descent is working correctly.
  • How to choose learning rate α\alphaα

Declare convergence if J(θ)J(\theta)J(θ) decreases by less than 10−310^{-3}10−3 in one iteration.

这是因为若将minθJ(θ)min_\theta J(\theta)minθ​J(θ)作为纵轴，将迭代次数作为横轴，那么得到的是是一个近似y=∣1x∣y=|\frac 1x|y=∣x1​∣的图像。当迭代次数达到一定量(ϵ)(\epsilon)(ϵ)后，梯度下降的量就几乎可以忽略不计了，所以该测试就判断函数已经收敛。不过要选择一个合适的阈值（threshold，ϵ\epsilonϵ）并不容易。

如果你的图像并不是上述的样子，那么说明你的α\alphaα值选取的不恰当。例如图像在0点附近形如指数函数图像，或者呈波浪形，就意味着你的α\alphaα值过大了，函数无法收敛。

Summary:

  • If α\alphaα is too small: slow convergence.
  • If α\alphaα is too large: J(θ)J(\theta)J(θ) may not decrease on every iteration; may not converge.

Recommended choices for α\alphaα:

…, 0.001, 0.003, 0.01, 0.03, 0.1, 0.3, 1,…

Sigmoid function (Logistic function):

g(z)=11+e−zg(z)=\frac1{1+e^{-z}} g(z)=1+e−z1​

It’s graph is likely function y=12tan⁡−1x+12y=\frac12\tan^{-1}x+\frac12y=21​tan−1x+21​, it has two asymptote at 0 and 1. And, hθ(0)=0.5h_\theta(0)=0.5hθ​(0)=0.5

Thus,

hθ(x)=11+e−θTxh_\theta(x)=\frac1{1+e^{-\theta^T x}} hθ​(x)=1+e−θTx1​

θTx≥0\theta^Tx\ge0θTx≥0 then hθ(x)=1h_\theta(x)=1hθ​(x)=1, θTx<0\theta^Tx<0θTx<0 then hθ(x)=0h_\theta(x)=0hθ​(x)=0

Interpretation of Hypothesis Output

hθ(x)=h_\theta(x)=hθ​(x)= estimated probability that y = 1 on input x

Example: if x=[x0x1]=[1tumorSize]x=\begin{bmatrix}x_0 \\x_1 \end{bmatrix}=\begin{bmatrix}1 \\ tumorSize\end{bmatrix}x=[x0​x1​​]=[1tumorSize​]

​ hθ(x)=0.7h_\theta(x)=0.7hθ​(x)=0.7

Tell patient that 70% chance of tumor being malignant.

Mathematical formula definition of the hypothesis for logistic regression

"Probability that y=1, given x, parameterized by θ\thetaθ":

P(y=0∣x;θ)+P(y=1∣x;θ)=1P(y=0∣x;θ)=1−P(y=1∣x;θ)P(y=0|x;\theta)+P(y=1|x;\theta)=1\\ P(y=0|x;\theta)=1-P(y=1|x;\theta) P(y=0∣x;θ)+P(y=1∣x;θ)=1P(y=0∣x;θ)=1−P(y=1∣x;θ)

predict “y=0y=0y=0” If hθ(x)≤0.5h_\theta(x)\le0.5hθ​(x)≤0.5

7.1 The problem of overfitting

  • Explain what is overfitting problem

Example: Linear regression (housing prices)

“Underfit”“High bias”,高偏差：强行用直线拟合曲线分布的数据，就像“持有偏见，固执认为房价变化就是线性的”，导致拟合结果偏差很大

“Overfit”“High variance”,高方差

Overfitting

If we have too many features, the learned hypothesis may fit the training set very well (J(θ)=12m∑i=1m(hθ(x(i))−y(i))2≈0J(θ)=\frac {1}{2m}\sum_{i=1}^m(h_θ(x^{(i)})-y^{(i)})^2\approx0J(θ)=2m1​∑i=1m​(hθ​(x(i))−y(i))2≈0), but fail to generalize to new examples(predict prices on new examples).

Example: Logistic regression

Addressing overfitting

If we have la lot of features, and very little training data, then overfitting can become a problem.

Two main options:

  1. Reduce number of features
    • Manually select which features to keep (but some feature must be abandoned)
    • Model selection algorithm (later will explain)
  2. Regularization
    • Keep all the features, but reduce magnitude/values of parameters θj\theta_jθj​
    • Works well when we have a lot of features, each of which contributes a bit to prediction yyy.

8.1 Non-linear hypothesis

Why we need Neural Networks?

当特征很多，线性回归和逻辑回归就不那么好用了。即使他们得出了能够拟合当前样本的结论，该结果也很有可能是过拟合的。

The neural networks which turns out to be a much better way to learn complex nonlinear hypothesis, even when your input feature space (n) is large.

z(2)z^{(2)}z(2) and a(2)a^{(2)}a(2) are both 3-dimensional vectors. Function ggg will process each element in z(2)z^{(2)}z(2) one by one.

Next, add bias unit: a0(2)=1a_0^{(2)}=1a0(2)​=1. Notice that a(2)∈R4a^{(2)}\in \mathbb R^4a(2)∈R4

z(3)=Θ(2)a(2)z^{(3)}=\Theta^{(2)}a^{(2)}z(3)=Θ(2)a(2)

hΘ(x)=a(3)=g(z(3))h_\Theta(x)=a^{(3)}=g(z^{(3)})hΘ​(x)=a(3)=g(z(3))

z(3)=Θ10(2)a0(2)+Θ11(2)a1(2)+Θ12(2)a2(2)+Θ13(2)a3(2)z^{(3)}=\Theta_{10}^{(2)}a_0^{(2)}+\Theta_{11}^{(2)}a_1^{(2)}+\Theta_{12}^{(2)}a_2^{(2)}+\Theta_{13}^{(2)}a_3^{(2)}z(3)=Θ10(2)​a0(2)​+Θ11(2)​a1(2)​+Θ12(2)​a2(2)​+Θ13(2)​a3(2)​ if you review to the neural networks function.

This process of computing h(x)h(x)h(x) is also called forward propagation, because we start off with the activations of the input-units and then we sort of forward-propagation that to the hidden layer and repeat this process until arriving output layer. The formula we have got is relatively an efficient way of computing h(x)h(x)h(x).

Neural Network learning its own features

如果只关注第二层和第三层，那么神经网络的行为类似于逻辑回归。然而神经网络输出层的输入是隐藏层计算或是说学习的结果（a1(2),a2(2),a3(2)...a_1^{(2)},a_2^{(2)},a_3^{(2)}...a1(2)​,a2(2)​,a3(2)​...），而不是逻辑回归中初始的特征项x1,x2,x3...x_1,x_2,x_3...x1​,x2​,x3​... 。前者较后者更适合作为假设参数，因此神经网络算法具备灵活快速尝试学习任意特征项，处理更多复杂特征的能力。

Other network architectures

The way that neural networks are connected are called the architecture (神经网络的架构). So the architecture refers to how different neurons are connected to each other.

13.1 K-means algorithm

K均值算法

K-means is a iterative algorithm. The preparation of the algorithm is to randomly initialize two (depends on how many cluster you want to assign) point, which called the cluster centroids (聚类中心). Then go through each point, detect and record which centre point they are closer to. Second is a move centroid step to the center of all the points in the same group. Repeat these two steps until the grouping of the points no longer changes.

Input:

  • KKK (number of clusters)
  • Training set {x(1),x(2),x(3),...x(m)}\{x^{(1)},x^{(2)},x^{(3)},...x^{(m)}\}{x(1),x(2),x(3),...x(m)}

x(i)∈Rnx^{(i)}\in \mathbb R^nx(i)∈Rn (drop x0=1x_0=1x0​=1 convention)

K-means algorithm

Randomly initialize KKK cluster centroids μ1,μ2,...,μK∈Rn\mu_1,\mu_2,...,\mu_K \in \mathbb R^nμ1​,μ2​,...,μK​∈Rn

Repeat {
// cluster assignment step

​ for iii = 1 to mmm

​ c(i)c^{(i)}c(i) := index (form 1 to KKK) of cluster controid close to x(i)x^{(i)}x(i) (calculate c(i)c^{(i)}c(i) though min⁡k∣∣x(i)−μk∣∣\min_k||x^{(i)}-\mu_k||mink​∣∣x(i)−μk​∣∣)

​ // move centroids step

​ for kkk = 1 to KKK

​ μk\mu_kμk​ := average (mean) of points assigned to cluster kkk
}

KKK means the number of centroids and the kkk means the index of each centriod.

If you have a cluster with no points assigned to it, the usual practice is to delete it.

  1. α\alphaα

4.3 Gradient descent in practice I: Feature Scaling

梯度下降运算中的实用技巧——特征缩放

Feature Scaling

Idea: Make sure flatten are on a similar scale.

E.g. x1x_1x1​= size(0-2000 feet2feet^2feet2)

​ x2x_2x2​= number of bedrooms (1-5)

It will be better to limit both x1x_1x1​ and x2x_2x2​ in [0,1]

x1=size(feet2)2000x_1=\frac{size(feet^2)}{2000}x1​=2000size(feet2)​

x2=numberOfBedroom5x_2=\frac{numberOfBedroom}{5}x2​=5numberOfBedroom​

椭圆相较于正圆需要更多的时间来计算梯度下降

More general, get every feature into approximately a −1≤xi≤1-1\le x_i\le1−1≤xi​≤1 range.

范围的上下限并不是被严格限制的，不过越接近-1和1越好。过大和过小都是不合适的。

Mean normalization

Replace xix_ixi​ with xi−µix_i-µ_ixi​−µi​ to make features have approximately zero mean (Do not apply to x0=1x_0=1x0​=1)
E.g.

x1=size(feet2)−10002000x_1=\frac{size(feet^2)-1000}{2000}x1​=2000size(feet2)−1000​

x2=numberOfBedroom−25x_2=\frac{numberOfBedroom-2}{5}x2​=5numberOfBedroom−2​

µiµ_iµi​ (1000 and 2) is considered as the average value of xix_ixi​ in training set

xi←xi−µirange(max−min)x_i\leftarrow \frac{x_i-µ_i}{range(max-min)} xi​←range(max−min)xi​−µi​​

4.4 Gradient descent in practice II: Learning rate

  • The chapter will center around the learning rate α\alphaα

Gradient descent

  • θj:=θj−α∂∂θjJ(θ)\theta_j:=\theta_j-\alpha \frac∂{∂\theta_j}J(\theta)θj​:=θj​−α∂θj​∂​J(θ)
  • “Debugging”: How to make sure gradient descent is working correctly.
  • How to choose learning rate α\alphaα

Declare convergence if J(θ)J(\theta)J(θ) decreases by less than 10−310^{-3}10−3 in one iteration.

这是因为若将minθJ(θ)min_\theta J(\theta)minθ​J(θ)作为纵轴，将迭代次数作为横轴，那么得到的是是一个近似y=∣1x∣y=|\frac 1x|y=∣x1​∣的图像。当迭代次数达到一定量(ϵ)(\epsilon)(ϵ)后，梯度下降的量就几乎可以忽略不计了，所以该测试就判断函数已经收敛。不过要选择一个合适的阈值（threshold，ϵ\epsilonϵ）并不容易。

如果你的图像并不是上述的样子，那么说明你的α\alphaα值选取的不恰当。例如图像在0点附近形如指数函数图像，或者呈波浪形，就意味着你的α\alphaα值过大了，函数无法收敛。

Summary:

  • If α\alphaα is too small: slow convergence.
  • If α\alphaα is too large: J(θ)J(\theta)J(θ) may not decrease on every iteration; may not converge.

Recommended choices for α\alphaα:

…, 0.001, 0.003, 0.01, 0.03, 0.1, 0.3, 1,…

7.1 The problem of overfitting

  • Explain what is overfitting problem

Example: Linear regression (housing prices)

“Underfit”“High bias”,高偏差：强行用直线拟合曲线分布的数据，就像“持有偏见，固执认为房价变化就是线性的”，导致拟合结果偏差很大

“Overfit”“High variance”,高方差

Overfitting

If we have too many features, the learned hypothesis may fit the training set very well (J(θ)=12m∑i=1m(hθ(x(i))−y(i))2≈0J(θ)=\frac {1}{2m}\sum_{i=1}^m(h_θ(x^{(i)})-y^{(i)})^2\approx0J(θ)=2m1​∑i=1m​(hθ​(x(i))−y(i))2≈0), but fail to generalize to new examples(predict prices on new examples).

Example: Logistic regression

Addressing overfitting

If we have la lot of features, and very little training data, then overfitting can become a problem.

Two main options:

  1. Reduce number of features
    • Manually select which features to keep (but some feature must be abandoned)
    • Model selection algorithm (later will explain)
  2. Regularization
    • Keep all the features, but reduce magnitude/values of parameters θj\theta_jθj​
    • Works well when we have a lot of features, each of which contributes a bit to prediction yyy.

8.1 Non-linear hypothesis

Why we need Neural Networks?

当特征很多，线性回归和逻辑回归就不那么好用了。即使他们得出了能够拟合当前样本的结论，该结果也很有可能是过拟合的。

The neural networks which turns out to be a much better way to learn complex nonlinear hypothesis, even when your input feature space (n) is large.

z(2)z^{(2)}z(2) and a(2)a^{(2)}a(2) are both 3-dimensional vectors. Function ggg will process each element in z(2)z^{(2)}z(2) one by one.

Next, add bias unit: a0(2)=1a_0^{(2)}=1a0(2)​=1. Notice that a(2)∈R4a^{(2)}\in \mathbb R^4a(2)∈R4

z(3)=Θ(2)a(2)z^{(3)}=\Theta^{(2)}a^{(2)}z(3)=Θ(2)a(2)

hΘ(x)=a(3)=g(z(3))h_\Theta(x)=a^{(3)}=g(z^{(3)})hΘ​(x)=a(3)=g(z(3))

z(3)=Θ10(2)a0(2)+Θ11(2)a1(2)+Θ12(2)a2(2)+Θ13(2)a3(2)z^{(3)}=\Theta_{10}^{(2)}a_0^{(2)}+\Theta_{11}^{(2)}a_1^{(2)}+\Theta_{12}^{(2)}a_2^{(2)}+\Theta_{13}^{(2)}a_3^{(2)}z(3)=Θ10(2)​a0(2)​+Θ11(2)​a1(2)​+Θ12(2)​a2(2)​+Θ13(2)​a3(2)​ if you review to the neural networks function.

This process of computing h(x)h(x)h(x) is also called forward propagation, because we start off with the activations of the input-units and then we sort of forward-propagation that to the hidden layer and repeat this process until arriving output layer. The formula we have got is relatively an efficient way of computing h(x)h(x)h(x).

Neural Network learning its own features

如果只关注第二层和第三层，那么神经网络的行为类似于逻辑回归。然而神经网络输出层的输入是隐藏层计算或是说学习的结果（a1(2),a2(2),a3(2)...a_1^{(2)},a_2^{(2)},a_3^{(2)}...a1(2)​,a2(2)​,a3(2)​...），而不是逻辑回归中初始的特征项x1,x2,x3...x_1,x_2,x_3...x1​,x2​,x3​... 。前者较后者更适合作为假设参数，因此神经网络算法具备灵活快速尝试学习任意特征项，处理更多复杂特征的能力。

Other network architectures

The way that neural networks are connected are called the architecture (神经网络的架构). So the architecture refers to how different neurons are connected to each other.

13.1 K-means algorithm

K均值算法

K-means is a iterative algorithm. The preparation of the algorithm is to randomly initialize two (depends on how many cluster you want to assign) point, which called the cluster centroids (聚类中心). Then go through each point, detect and record which centre point they are closer to. Second is a move centroid step to the center of all the points in the same group. Repeat these two steps until the grouping of the points no longer changes.

Input:

  • KKK (number of clusters)
  • Training set {x(1),x(2),x(3),...x(m)}\{x^{(1)},x^{(2)},x^{(3)},...x^{(m)}\}{x(1),x(2),x(3),...x(m)}

x(i)∈Rnx^{(i)}\in \mathbb R^nx(i)∈Rn (drop x0=1x_0=1x0​=1 convention)

K-means algorithm

Randomly initialize KKK cluster centroids μ1,μ2,...,μK∈Rn\mu_1,\mu_2,...,\mu_K \in \mathbb R^nμ1​,μ2​,...,μK​∈Rn

Repeat {
// cluster assignment step

​ for iii = 1 to mmm

​ c(i)c^{(i)}c(i) := index (form 1 to KKK) of cluster controid close to x(i)x^{(i)}x(i) (calculate c(i)c^{(i)}c(i) though min⁡k∣∣x(i)−μk∣∣\min_k||x^{(i)}-\mu_k||mink​∣∣x(i)−μk​∣∣)

​ // move centroids step

​ for kkk = 1 to KKK

​ μk\mu_kμk​ := average (mean) of points assigned to cluster kkk
}

KKK means the number of centroids and the kkk means the index of each centriod.

If you have a cluster with no points assigned to it, the usual practice is to delete it.
